recipes.title: Chocolate Chip Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Classic soft and chewy chocolate chip cookies loaded with protein. These macro-verified cookies deliver 21g protein per serving while tasting like the real thing.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.
In a large bowl, whisk together the oat flour, protein powder, baking soda, and salt until well combined.
In a separate bowl, mix the almond butter, maple syrup, egg, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry and stir until just combined. Fold in the chocolate chips. Do not overmix.
Scoop 12 equal portions of dough onto the prepared baking sheet. Flatten slightly with your palm. Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are golden but centers look slightly underdone.
Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack. They will firm up as they cool.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Rich, flourless peanut butter cookies with an incredible 24g protein per cookie. Made with just 4 main ingredients for the ultimate macro-friendly treat.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine the peanut butter, eggs, sweetener, and vanilla. Mix until smooth.
Add the protein powder and baking soda. Stir until a thick dough forms.
Roll dough into 12 balls and place on the baking sheet. Use a fork to create the classic crosshatch pattern, pressing down to flatten slightly.
Bake for 9-10 minutes until edges are set but centers are still soft. Do not overbake.
Cool on the baking sheet for 10 minutes. Cookies will firm up significantly as they cool.

recipes.title: No-Bake Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Quick and easy no-bake protein cookies ready in just 15 minutes. Perfect for meal prep with 18g protein and a fudgy, chewy texture.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the oats, protein powder, and cocoa powder. Stir to combine.
Add the peanut butter, honey, almond milk, and vanilla extract. Mix until a thick, sticky dough forms.
If the mixture is too dry, add more almond milk 1 tablespoon at a time. If too wet, add more oats.
Using wet hands, roll the mixture into 12 balls and flatten into cookie shapes on a parchment-lined tray.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes until firm. Store in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

recipes.title: Oatmeal Raisin Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Soft and chewy oatmeal raisin cookies with 19g protein. Cinnamon-spiced and loaded with fiber for a satisfying, macro-friendly snack.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine oats, oat flour, protein powder, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together applesauce, maple syrup, and egg.
Pour wet ingredients into dry and stir until combined. Fold in raisins.
Drop rounded tablespoons onto the baking sheet. Bake for 12-14 minutes until edges are golden.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.

recipes.title: Double Chocolate Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Decadent double chocolate cookies with 22g protein. Rich cocoa base studded with chocolate chips for the ultimate chocolate lover's protein treat.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, protein powder, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl, combine almond butter, maple syrup, and egg until smooth.
Add wet to dry and stir until just combined. Fold in chocolate chips.
Scoop 12 portions onto the baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes until set around edges.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes. Cookies will be very soft but will firm up.

recipes.title: Snickerdoodle Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Soft, pillowy snickerdoodle cookies rolled in cinnamon sugar with 20g protein. A guilt-free version of the classic that tastes just like the original.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, protein powder, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, beat coconut oil and sweetener until fluffy. Add egg and vanilla, mix well.
Add dry ingredients to wet and mix until a dough forms.
Mix cinnamon and sweetener in a small bowl. Roll dough into 12 balls, then roll each in the cinnamon mixture.
Place on baking sheet and flatten slightly. Bake for 8-10 minutes until edges are set.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring.

recipes.title: Birthday Cake Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Festive funfetti-style protein cookies with 19g protein. Loaded with sprinkles and cake batter flavor for a celebration-worthy treat.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, protein powder, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, combine Greek yogurt, maple syrup, coconut oil, vanilla, and butter extract.
Add wet to dry and mix until combined. Gently fold in sprinkles.
Scoop 12 portions onto the baking sheet. Flatten slightly.
Bake for 9-10 minutes until edges are just set. Do not overbake.
Press additional sprinkles on top while still warm. Cool completely.

recipes.title: Vegan Protein Cookies
recipes.description: 100% plant-based protein cookies with 17g protein. Made with pea protein and flax eggs for a delicious vegan-friendly treat.

instructions.text: Mix ground flaxseed with water and let sit for 5 minutes until gel-like.
Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, protein powder, baking soda, and salt.
Combine flax eggs, almond butter, maple syrup, and vanilla until smooth.
Add wet to dry and mix until combined. Fold in chocolate chips.
Scoop 12 portions onto baking sheet. Bake for 11-12 minutes until edges are golden.
Cool on baking sheet for 10 minutes before transferring.

recipes.title: Gluten-Free Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Celiac-safe gluten-free protein cookies with 20g protein. Made with certified GF oats and almond flour for a safe, delicious treat.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together GF oat flour, almond flour, protein powder, baking soda, and salt.
Combine almond butter, maple syrup, egg, and vanilla until smooth.
Add wet to dry and mix until a dough forms.
Scoop 12 portions onto the baking sheet. Flatten slightly.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are golden.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring.

recipes.title: Protein Cookie Dough Bites
recipes.description: Edible cookie dough bites with 15g protein per serving. Safe to eat raw with no eggs and heat-treated flour for worry-free snacking.

instructions.text: If not using pre-treated flour, microwave oat flour for 1 minute, stirring halfway, to kill any bacteria.
In a large bowl, combine oat flour, protein powder, and salt.
Add almond butter, maple syrup, almond milk, and vanilla. Mix until a dough forms.
Fold in mini chocolate chips.
Roll into 24 small balls. Place on a parchment-lined tray.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes until firm. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

recipes.title: White Chocolate Macadamia Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Buttery white chocolate macadamia cookies with 18g protein. A bakery-style favorite made macro-friendly without sacrificing flavor.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, protein powder, baking soda, and salt.
Combine cashew butter, maple syrup, egg, and vanilla until smooth.
Add wet to dry and mix. Fold in white chocolate chips and macadamia nuts.
Scoop 12 portions onto baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are golden.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring.

recipes.title: Protein Cookies for Kids
recipes.description: Kid-approved protein cookies with 12g protein and no artificial sweeteners. Perfect for lunchboxes and after-school snacks.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, protein powder, baking soda, and salt.
Mash banana until smooth. Add honey, coconut oil, and vanilla. Mix well.
Add wet to dry and mix until combined. Fold in chocolate chips.
Scoop 16 small portions onto baking sheet.
Bake for 9-10 minutes until edges are golden.
Cool completely before packing in lunchboxes.

recipes.title: Cottage Cheese Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Ultra-soft protein cookies made with cottage cheese for 23g protein. The secret ingredient creates an incredibly moist, tender texture.

instructions.text: Blend cottage cheese until completely smooth with no lumps.
Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Combine blended cottage cheese, egg, maple syrup, and vanilla.
Add oat flour, protein powder, baking powder, and salt. Mix until combined.
Scoop 12 portions onto baking sheet. Flatten slightly.
Bake for 12-14 minutes until edges are set and tops are slightly golden.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes. These are very soft when warm.

recipes.title: Greek Yogurt Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Incredibly moist protein cookies made with Greek yogurt for 21g protein. Light, fluffy texture with a subtle tang.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Combine Greek yogurt, egg, maple syrup, and vanilla until smooth.
Add oat flour, protein powder, baking powder, and salt. Mix until combined.
Fold in chocolate chips if using.
Scoop 12 portions onto baking sheet. Flatten slightly.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are set.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring.

recipes.title: Almond Flour Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Low-carb almond flour protein cookies with 19g protein. Keto-friendly with only 8g net carbs per cookie.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 325°F (165°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together almond flour, protein powder, baking soda, and salt.
Combine almond butter, sweetener, egg, and vanilla until smooth.
Add wet to dry and mix until a dough forms. Fold in chocolate chips.
Scoop 12 portions onto baking sheet. Flatten to 1/2 inch thick.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are golden. Watch carefully as almond flour browns quickly.
Cool on baking sheet for 10 minutes. Cookies will be soft but firm up as they cool.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Spice Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Soft, cakey pumpkin spice cookies with 18g protein. Perfect for fall with warm spices and real pumpkin puree.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, protein powder, pumpkin pie spice, baking powder, and salt.
Combine pumpkin puree, maple syrup, egg, coconut oil, and vanilla.
Add wet to dry and mix until just combined. Batter will be thick.
Scoop 14 portions onto baking sheet. These won't spread much, so flatten slightly.
Bake for 12-14 minutes until edges are set and tops spring back when touched.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring.

recipes.title: Lemon Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Bright, zesty lemon cookies with 17g protein. Light and refreshing with a tender crumb and optional lemon glaze.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, protein powder, baking powder, and salt.
Combine Greek yogurt, maple syrup, coconut oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, and vanilla.
Add wet to dry and mix until just combined.
Scoop 12 portions onto baking sheet. Flatten slightly.
Bake for 9-10 minutes until edges are just set. Do not overbake.
Cool completely. Optional: drizzle with a glaze made from powdered sweetener and lemon juice.

recipes.title: Monster Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Loaded monster cookies with oats, peanut butter, chocolate, and M&Ms with 20g protein. A protein-packed version of the classic.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Combine oats, protein powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, mix peanut butter, maple syrup, egg, and vanilla until smooth.
Add wet to dry and mix. Fold in chocolate chips and half the M&Ms.
Scoop 12 portions onto baking sheet. Press remaining M&Ms on top.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are set.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring.

recipes.title: High Protein Cookies (30g)
recipes.description: Maximum protein cookies with 30g protein per serving. Designed for serious athletes and those with high protein goals.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, whey protein, casein protein, baking soda, and salt.
Combine Greek yogurt, maple syrup, egg whites, and vanilla until smooth.
Add wet to dry and mix until a thick batter forms. Let rest 5 minutes.
Scoop 10 large portions onto baking sheet. Flatten to 3/4 inch thick.
Bake for 11-12 minutes until edges are set and tops are slightly golden.
Cool on baking sheet for 10 minutes. These are dense and will firm up significantly.

recipes.title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Protein Cookies
recipes.description: The ultimate combo of chocolate and peanut butter with 22g protein. Fudgy chocolate base with a peanut butter swirl.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, protein powder, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt.
Combine almond butter, maple syrup, egg, and vanilla until smooth.
Add wet to dry and mix until a dough forms.
Scoop 12 portions onto baking sheet. Make a small indent in each.
Add 1/2 teaspoon peanut butter to each indent. Use a toothpick to swirl.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are set.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring.

recipes.title: Banana Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Naturally sweetened banana cookies with 16g protein. Made with ripe bananas for moisture and natural sweetness.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, protein powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
Mash bananas until smooth. Add maple syrup, egg, and vanilla. Mix well.
Add wet to dry and mix until combined. Fold in walnuts if using.
Scoop 14 portions onto baking sheet. Flatten slightly.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are golden.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring.

recipes.title: Sugar-Free Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Zero added sugar protein cookies with 19g protein. Sweetened only with monk fruit and stevia for diabetic-friendly enjoyment.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 325°F (165°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together almond flour, protein powder, oat fiber, baking soda, and salt.
Combine almond butter, sweetener, egg, and vanilla until smooth.
Add wet to dry and mix until a dough forms. Fold in chocolate chips.
Scoop 12 portions onto baking sheet. Flatten to 1/2 inch thick.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are golden.
Cool on baking sheet for 10 minutes. These firm up significantly as they cool.

recipes.title: Thin & Crispy Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Perfectly thin and crispy protein cookies with 15g protein. Satisfying crunch with every bite for those who prefer crispy over chewy.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, protein powder, baking soda, and salt.
Combine melted coconut oil, sweetener, egg, and vanilla until smooth.
Add wet to dry and mix. Fold in chocolate chips.
Scoop 16 small portions onto baking sheet, spacing 3 inches apart. Flatten very thin.
Bake for 12-14 minutes until golden brown throughout.
Cool on baking sheet completely. Cookies will crisp up as they cool.

recipes.title: Red Velvet Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Stunning red velvet cookies with cream cheese frosting and 18g protein. Perfect for Valentine's Day or any special occasion.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, protein powder, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt.
Combine Greek yogurt, maple syrup, egg, food coloring, and vanilla.
Add wet to dry and mix until combined. Fold in white chocolate chips.
Scoop 12 portions onto baking sheet. Flatten slightly.
Bake for 9-10 minutes until edges are set.
Cool completely. Optional: top with a cream cheese frosting drizzle.

recipes.title: Gingerbread Protein Cookies
recipes.description: Warm, spiced gingerbread cookies with 17g protein. Perfect for the holidays with classic gingerbread flavor and soft texture.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together oat flour, protein powder, ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, baking soda, and salt.
Combine molasses, maple syrup, egg, and melted coconut oil.
Add wet to dry and mix until a soft dough forms.
Refrigerate dough for 15 minutes for easier handling.
Roll into 14 balls and place on baking sheet. Flatten slightly.
Bake for 9-10 minutes until edges are set but centers are soft.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes. Optional: decorate with icing.
